targetString: B'Rat coronavirisi ya WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIVI1) oyo ezali lekola SARS oyo babengi mpe coronavirisi ya WIV1 oyo ezali lekola SARS ezali maladi ya mpema oyo euti na coronavirisi (SARS-CoV) oyo euti na bangembo ya Chine (Rhinolophus sinicus).

sourceString: Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
targetString: Lekola ba coronavirisi nyonso, bavirions ezali ba RNA moko-moko ya positice oyo ekangami na kati ya envelope

sourceString: The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Etid elobi ete bangembo moto bauti na SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
targetString: Analyse ya Phylogenetic emonindenge SARS ekoki kouta bangembo ekota bato na nzela ya civets ya bachinois.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Koluka kisi ya b'COVID-19 ezali etid oyo ezali kosalema mpona kosala vaccin to kisi oyo eko kitisa likama ya coronarivirisi 2019-20 (COVID-19) na kati ya nzoto ya moto.

sourceString: The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.
targetString: Esika ya International ya komeka bakisi ya OMS emona ba etid koleka 536 oyo ezali kosalema mpona nsima ya COVID-19, na komeka bakisi ya ba virisi misusu.

sourceString: In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Na sanza ya misato, OMS ebandaki ‘'KOMEKA YA BOMOKO'' na bamboka 10, kotia bankombo ya bato mingi oyo bazali kobela COVID-19 na komeka bakisi minei mpona komona oyo wapi eleki.

sourceString: A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.
targetString: Mokanda ebimaki na sanza ya minei 2020 mpona kolandela ba kisi oyo bazali komeka na ya vaccin ya COVID-19. Kosala vaccin na kisi ezali baetap mingi, esengaki bambula 5 mpona kozwa ya malamu.

sourceString: Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
targetString: Kosala kisi ezali mosala oyo ezali komema kisi to vaccin na bazando ntango combinaison ya malamu eko yebana na etid ya koluka kisi.

sourceString: It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.
targetString: Elandi etid ya bamicroorganisms na laboratoire ya banyama, kosenga toli, lekola na FDA, investigation ya kisi esengeli esalema mpona komeka ebanda na nzoto ya bato, mpe ekoki kosenga etap ya kozwa mokanda oyo endimi kisi wana ekota zando.

sourceString: Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
targetString: Koluka kisi to Vaccin ya COVID-19 ebandaka na kosangisa bakisi na prophylactic ya baccin na bakisi ya virisi ya lobi.

sourceString: New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
targetString: Bakisi ya sika (NCEs, oyo babengi mpe bamelecule to NMEs) ezali bacombinaison oyo euti na koluka kisi to vaccin ya virisi.

sourceString: These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
targetString: Ekoki kozala ntina mpe malamu na oyo etungisi maladi ya COVID-19.

sourceString: At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
targetString: Na ebandeli ya koluka vaccin to kisi, moke eyebani na soki ezali malamu, toxic, pharmacockinets, na nzoto ya NCE ya bato.

sourceString: It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
targetString: Ezali mosala ya koluka kisi oyo esengi kososola nyonso liboso ya kopesa yango na bato.

sourceString: A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).
targetString: Likambo mosusu ya monene na koluka kisi ezali kopesa mikolo ya komeka mpe ndenge nini komela yango (‘'Komeka na bato ya liboso'') [FIH] to Dose ya Bato ya Liboso [FHD], oyo bazalaki kobenga liboso ‘'Ya liboso na moto'' [FIM]).

sourceString: In addition, drug development must establish the physicochemical properties of the NCE: its chemical makeup, stability, and solubility.
targetString: Mpe, kisi esengeli ezala na biloko ya physicochemical ya NCE: ndenge nini kisi esalemi, ezali na nini n akati, ezali malamu, mpe emwaganaka na mayi

sourceString: Manufacturers must optimize the process they use to make the chemical so they can scale up from a medicinal chemist producing milligrams, to manufacturing on the kilogram and ton scale.
targetString: Ba oyo basalaka biloko esengeli bapusa liboso baetap ya kosala kisi mpo na oyo basal aba milligrams, basal aba kilogram mpe nsima ba ton.

sourceString: They further examine the product for suitability to package as capsules, tablets, aerosol, intramuscular injectable, subcutaneous injectable, or intravenous formulations.
targetString: Nsima bako mona soki kisi ezali komwangana na mayi mpona kokanga yango, kosali bakisi ya mokomoko, aerosol, kosalisa yango na tonga mpona ba miskle, tonga ya bisika misusu to formule ya intravenous.

sourceString: Together, these processes are known in preclinical and clinical development as chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC).Many aspects of drug development focus on satisfying the regulatory requirements of drug licensing authorities.
targetString: Na bomoko, baetap oyo eyebani na mosala ya koluka bakisi lekola chimie, kosala mpe kolandela (CMC). Mosala mingi ya kosala kisi ezali mpona kosepelisa mibeko oyo gouvernema atie mpona kondima kisi.

sourceString: These generally constitute tests designed to determine the major toxicities of a novel compound prior to first use in humans.
targetString: Oyo ezali kosala baekzame mpona koyeba soki ezali malamu mpona combinaison ya sika na ba oyo bato basalela liboso.

sourceString: The Canadian government announced CA$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian universities, with plans to establish a "vaccine bank" of new vaccines for implementation if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Gouvernema ya Canada alobaki ete CA$275 milio ezali na baprojet 96 mpona etid ya COVID-19, lekola koluka vaccin na bauniversite ya Canada, oyo balingi basala ezali kosala ‘'banque ya bavaccin'' mpona bavaccin ya sika mpona kosalisa soki coronavirisi mosusu eye.

sourceString: Clinical trial programs involve three, multiple-year stages toward product approval, and a fourth, post-approval stage for ongoing safety monitoring of the vaccine or drug therapy:
targetString: Program ya Komeka bakisi ezali kosalema na baetap misato, bambula mingi mpo ete kisi endimama, etap ya minei, etap ya komeka mpe kosala etid mpona komona ete kisi to vaccin ezali malamu.

sourceString: Phase I trials, usually in healthy volunteers, determine safety and dosing.
targetString: Komeka ya etap ya I, na bato oyo bazali na kolongono malamu, ekoyebisa quantite ya komela kisi.

sourceString: Phase II trials are used to establish an initial reading of efficacy and further explore safety in small numbers of people having the disease targeted by the NCE.
targetString: Phase II ekolakisi makasi na yango mpe bolamu na kati ya bato moke oyo bazali na maladi elandani na NCE.

sourceString: Phase III trials are large, pivotal trials to determine safety and efficacy in sufficiently large numbers of people with the COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Phase III ezali komeka ya monene, mpona komona soki kisi ezali kosimba mpe ezali malamu na kati ya bato ebele oyo bazali kobela na COVID-19.

sourceString: If safety and efficacy are adequately proved, clinical testing may stop at this step and the NCE advances to the new drug application (NDA) stage to begin marketing.
targetString: Soki malamu mpe makasi na yango emonani malamu, komeka ekoki kosuka awa mpe NCE ekosenga mokanda mpona nokotisa nkombo ya kisi (NDA) na zando mpe koteka yango.

sourceString: Phase IV trials are post-approval trials that may be a condition attached by the FDA, also called post-market surveillance studies.
targetString: Phase IV ezali te nsima ya kondima komeka ya kisi oyo ekoki kozala etap oyo FDA esengi, mpe oyo babengi mpe kolandela nsima ya kokotisa kisi na zando.

sourceString: In addition to the tests required to move a novel vaccine or antiviral drug into the clinic for the first time, manufacturers must ensure that any long-term or chronic toxicities are well-defined, including effects on systems not previously monitored (fertility, reproduction, immune system, among others).
targetString: Na Baekzame oyo esengeli esalema mpona kopusa vaccin to kisi na balicinic mpona mbala ya liboso, bato oyo bazali kosala bakisi esengeli bamona ete ba effet ya milayi mpe esosolami, mpe ba effet na oyo nani bamonaki te (Bato oyo balingi bazwa zemi, ba nzoto oyo ekoki kozwa zemi, system immune, mpe misusu).

sourceString: In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
targetString: Na Etats Unis etap oyo ebengami ‘'Application ya kisi ya sika'' to NDA.

sourceString: A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
targetString: Kobongisa kisi ntango kisi esi ebimi ezali ‘'kobongisa ndenge ezali'' soki ba etid mingi na ntango bazalaki komeka epesi ba effet ya malamu to ya mabe.

sourceString: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
targetString: Bomoko ya Koluka ya mokili na ya koluka ya Europe na bato oyo bazali na lepital na COVID-19 ya makasi ezali kosunga na kobongisa bakisi na komona formule nini na minei oyo ekosimba.

sourceString: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
targetString: Kobongisa kisi na Phase II-III na bato ekoki kokitisa mikolo ya komeka mpe ekoyebisa na makambo mingi te, ekoki mpe kotinda bato bazwa badecision ya noki na kolongola kisi yango to kokende liboso na yango, mpe kobongisa kisi mpona bamboka ya bapaya.

sourceString: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
targetString: Bakisi mingi ya sika (NCEs) basimbaka te ntango kisi ezali kosalema, mpo ete ezali toxic to mpo ete ezali kosimba makasi te, lekola Phase II-III elakisi.

sourceString: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
targetString: Kokwea ya bakisi bengami ‘'taux ya attrition'', esengi badecision esalema na ebandeli ya koluka kisi mpona ‘koboma'' project na ebandeli mpe kobungisa mbongo te.

sourceString: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
targetString: Etid moko na 2010 emonaki etid oyo batie mbongo mpe oyo bazali kofuta bango moko mpona kokotisa kisi na zando na US$1.8bilio mpe $870 milio.

sourceString: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
targetString: Talo ya kaikati ya komeka ya 2015-16 mpona kisi 10 ya cancer ezalaki $648 milio.

sourceString: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
targetString: Na emoneli ya 2016 ya bakisi 106 oyo ezalaki komekama, mbongo oyo mosali bakisi abimisaki na Phase III oyo esimbaki ezalaki $2.6bilio (na 2013 dollars), mbongo oyo ezali komata bambula nyonso na 8.5

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
targetString: Komeka ya bakisi nsambo oyo esalemaki elakisi ete ekoki kobikisa na palu, mpe baetid mingi ya hydroxychloroquine to chloroquine phosphate.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Kisi oyo ezalaka mpe babandi kosalela ezali mingi na Chine, na 9 na Phase III na remdesivir na kati ya bamboka mingi elobi rapor na nsuka ya sanza ya minei.

sourceString: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
targetString: Ebandi na Bill na Melinda Gates Foundation na bato misusu oyo batie US$125 milio mpe na kosala na Organization Mondiale ya Sante, kopusa ya kisi ya COVID-19 ebandaki na sanza ya misato, epusaki koluka kisi, kososola yango, kosala yango, mpe kobimisa mpona bato babanda komela.

sourceString: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
targetString: Coalition ya Etid ya Bakisi mpona COVID-19 ebimisaki baresultat ya komeka na international mpo ete ekosimba kuna makasi.

sourceString: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
targetString: Na ebandeli ya 2020, mingi basalaki bakisi ya kobundela maladi na bakisi oyo ezali to babandaki baetid ya komeka ya sika mpona kolonga COVID-19.

sourceString: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Mpona kisi oyo basi bandimaki (lekola hydroxychloroquine mpona palu), Phase III-IV ya komeka na kati bankama ya bato oyo bazali kobela COVID-19 ebandaki kosalisa kisi oyo ezalaka mpona kobikisa COVID-19.

sourceString: As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
targetString: Na ebandeli ya sanza ya minei 2020, bato 103 babandaki Phase I-IV mpe na sanza ya minei tozali kozela baresultat ya bato 29.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.
targetString: Na sanza ya misato, Organisation Mondial ya Sante (OMS) ebandali ‘'Koluka na bomoko'' na bamboka 10 mpona komona kati na bankama ya bato oyo bazali kobela na COVID-19 soki bakisi ya virisi mpe ya anti-inflamatoire ezali kosimba mpe yango nani esalema te mpona maladi ya COVID-19.

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
targetString: Moko na bakisi yango ekokitisa boni ya bato oyo bazali kokufa?

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
targetString: Moko na bakisi yango ekokitisa mikolo oyo esenge moto azala na lepital?

sourceString: Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
targetString: Bakisi yango ezali kokitisa mpona bato oyo bazali ya pneumonia etumbolami na COVID-19 ya kosalisa baventilateir to kosalisama makasi?

sourceString: Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.
targetString: Bakisi yango ekoki kosalisama mpona kokitisa bamaladi oyo COVID-19 ezali kopesa na basali ya lepital mpe bato oyo bakoki kozwa yango noki to kotumbola bamaladi ya makasi? Kotia nkombo ya bato oyo bazali na COVID-19 ekomi lisusu mpasi te, mpe kondima na bango, esalemi na siteweb ya WHO.

sourceString: After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
targetString: Nsima ya komeka basali bako yebia kisi nini ezali na lepital, OMS eko yebisa lepilal mpe ndenge ya kosalisa COVID-19.

sourceString: The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
targetString: Monganga oyo azali kosunga moto ameka akolandela na kokoma mokanda oyo eyebisi wapI, mpe kisi, na siteweb ya OMS.

sourceString: A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
targetString: Tableau ya kolandela kobatelama ya banganga ya OMS ezali kosunga badecision mpe kochange makambo soki esengami

sourceString: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.
targetString: Mosala mosusu ya Bomoko, babengi ‘'Koluka'', ebandaki na sanza ya misato na bamboka nsambo na ISERM (Paris, France). targetString: Misusu na ebandeli Phase II ya komeka to bakisi misusu na komeka ya Phase I mpe bazali te.

sourceString: Hydroxychloroquine is more commonly available than chloroquine in the United States.
targetString: Hydroxycloroquine ezali mingi na Etats Unis koleka Chloroquine.

sourceString: Although several countries use chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for treatment of persons hospitalized with COVID-19, as of March 2020 the drug has not been formally approved through clinical trials in the United States.
targetString: Bamboka mingi basalelaka chloroquine to hydroxychloroquine mpona kosalisa bato oyo bazali na lepital kobela na COVID-19, na sanza ya misato 2020 kisi yango endimamaki naino te mpona komeka na Etats Unis.

sourceString: Chloroquine has been recommended by Chinese, South Korean and Italian health authorities for the treatment of COVID-19, although these agencies and the US CDC noted contraindications for people with heart disease or diabetes.
targetString: Chine mpe epesi toli ya kosalela Chloroquine, Core ya Sud na bakonzi ya kolongono na Italie mpona kosalisa COVID-19, kasi bango na CDC ya New York bamoni ete ezali malamu te mpona bato oyo bazali kobela motema.

sourceString: Both drugs have extensive interactions with prescription drugs, affecting the therapeutic dose and disease mitigation.
targetString: Bakisi nyonso mibale ezali na bakisi ya zando, yango etungisi dose oyo esengami mpe kokitisa kopalangana ya maladi.

sourceString: Some people have allergic reactions to these drugs.On 12 April, a preliminary clinical trial conducted at a hospital in Brazil was stopped when several people given high doses of chloroquine for COVID-19 infection developed irregular heart rates, causing 11 deaths.
targetString: Bato misusu bazali allergic na bakisi oyo. Na mokolo ya 12 sanza ya minei, komeka ebandaki na lepital na Brazil esukaki ntango bapesaki bato mingi chloroquine ebele mpona COVID-19 mitema ekomaki kobeta noki, nsima 11 bakufaki.

targetString: Bango nyonso babotaki na nzela ya kobota malamu.

sourceString: The samples of breast milk, amniotic fluid, cord blood and neonatal throat swab were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative.In another study on 15 pregnant women, majority of the patients presented with fever and cough, while laboratory tests yielded lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.
targetString: Mayi ya mabele, mayi ya amniotic, makila ya nsinga mpe mayi ya kati ya mongongo bamonaki soki ezalaki na SARS-CoV-2, kasi ata moko te ezalaki na yango, Na etid mosusu na basi ya zemi 15, mingi bayaki na kosukosu na fefele, mpe baekzame ya laboratoire emonaki lymphocytopenia kati na bato 12.

sourceString: Computed tomography findings of these patients were consistent with previous reports of non-pregnant patients, consisting of ground-glass opacities at early stage.
targetString: Makambo oyo elakisaki ezalaki elongo moko na bato oyo bazalaki na zemi te, ezalaki na baopacite na ebandeli.

sourceString: Follow-up images after delivery showed no progression of pneumonia.Media reports indicate that over 100 women with COVID-19 might have delivered, and in March 2020, no maternal deaths were reported.
targetString: Bilili oyo elandi elakisi pusa ya pneumonia te. Barapor ya basango kati na basi 100 na COVID-19 oyo ya sanza ya misato 2020, moko te akufaki na kobota.

sourceString: Their guidelines thus advise that any pregnant person admitted to hospital with a COVID-19 infection should receive at least 10 days of prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin after being discharged from the hospital.
targetString: Batoli na bango esengaki mwasi ya zemi nyonso oyo akoti lepital na COVID-19 esengeli amela prophylaction heparin nsima ya kobima lepital mpona mikolo 10.

sourceString: There are no data yet concerning the implications of COVID-19 infections for labour.
targetString: Baetid ezali te mpona kosolola nini COVID-19 ezali kosala na kobota.

sourceString: One infant girl born to a mother with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that she had been infected in utero and supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.
targetString: Mwana moko ya mwasi oyo abotamaki na mama oyo azalaki na COVID-19 azalaki na IgM ebele ba ngonga mibale nsima ya kobota, koloba ete apesaki mwana na libumu maladi.

sourceString: A small study involving 6 confirmed COVID-19 mothers showed no indication of SARS-COV-19 in their newborns' throats or serum but antibodies were present in neonatal blood sera samples, including IgM in two of the infants.
targetString: Etid moko oyo ya bamama 6 na COVID-19 elakisaki te SARS-COV-19 na mingongo ya bana na bango to nsumba, mpe IgM mingi na bana mibale.

sourceString: This is not usually passed from mother to fetus so further research is required to know whether the virus crossed the placenta or whether placentas of women in the study were damaged or abnormal.
targetString: Oyo elekaka te mama na mwana esengeli etid mosusu esalema mpona koyeba soki virisi eleki placenta to baplacenta ya basi etobolaki to ezalaki mabe.

sourceString: Since COVID-19 shows similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, it is likely that their effect on pregnancy are similar.
targetString: Lekola COVID-19 ezali keloko SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV ekoki koloba ete ndenge bazali kosala na zemi ezali ndenge moko.

sourceString: Four of seven had first trimester miscarriage, two of five had fetal growth restriction in the second trimester, and four of five had preterm birth.
targetString: Minei na nsambo zemi ebimaki na baposo ya liboso, mibale kati na mitano zemi azalaki kokola noki te na trimester ya mibale, mpe minei na mitano babotaki liboso ya mikolo.

sourceString: None of the newborns were infected with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Ata mwana moko te azalaki na SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A report of ten cases of MERS- CoV infection in pregnancy in Saudi Arabia showed that the clinical presentation is variable, from mild to severe infection.
targetString: Rapor ya bato zomi na MERS- CoV na zemi na Saudi Arabie elakisaki ete ezali kosala ndenge moko te soki maladi ezali ya pete to ya makasi.

sourceString: The outcome was favorable in a majority of the cases, but the infant death rate was 27%.A recent review suggested that COVID-19 appeared to be less lethal to mothers and infants than SARS and MERS but that there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks' gestation.
targetString: Baresulta ezalaki mabe te na basi mingi, kasi kufa ya bana ezalaki 27%. Etid ya sika elakisi ete COVID-19 ezali mabe makasi mingi te na bamama na bana koleka SARS na MERS kasi kobota liboso ya mikolo ezali kosalema mingi na ba poso 28.

sourceString: The World Health Organization and  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention of the United States advises pregnant women to do the same things as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering cough, avoid interacting with sick people, cleaning hands with soap and water or sanitizer.
targetString: Organisation Mondial ya Sante mpe esika ya kolandela mpe kopekisa bamaladi na Etats Unis elobi na basi ya zemi basala makambo moko na bato nyonso, lekola kozipa soki bazali kokosola, kozala na bato ya maladi te, kosoka maboko na sabuni mpe kisi ya koboma mikrobe.

sourceString: A survey conducted in Shanghai among pregnant women in different trimesters of pregnancy identified a strong demand for online access to health information and services.
targetString: Survey moko na Shangai kati na basi ya zemi na batrimeste mingi elakisi ete mposa ya lisungi ya kolongono na nzela internet ezali makasi.

sourceString: People expecting their first baby were more willing to have online consultation and guidance than who had previously given birth.The RCOG and RCM recommend that in-person appointments be deferred by 7 days after the start of symptoms of COVID-19 or 14 days if another person in the household has symptoms.
targetString: Bato oyo bazali kobota mwana na bango ya liboso basepelaki komona monganga na internet koleka ba oyo babota lioso. RCOG na RCM balobi ete banganga bamona basi ya zemi nsima ya mikolo 7 nsima ya ebandeli ya basymptomi ya COVID19 to mikolo 14 soki moto mosusu na ndako azali na basymptomi.

sourceString: Fever subsequently developed in three asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Fefele ebandaki na bato misato oyo basalaki na basymptomi te.

sourceString: One patient who had tested negative subsequently became symptomatic postpartum and tested positive three days after the initial negative test.
targetString: Moto moko oyo azalaki negative nsima ya kobota, mikolo misato oyo elandaki akomaki positive kasi azalaki na basymptomi te.

sourceString: The doctors conducting the screening recommended that in order to reduce infection and allocate PPE, due to high numbers of patients presenting as asymptomatic, universal screening of pregnant patients should be conducted.
targetString: Banganga oyo bazalaki kosunga ye balobaki mpona kokitisa maladi etambola mpe na ba PPE, mpona bato mingi oyo bazali na basymptomi te, esengeli ekzame mpona basi ya zemi esalema ntango nyonso.

sourceString: They also suggest that people with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 should have continuous electronic fetal monitoring.
targetString: Mpe balobi ete bato oyo bakoki kozala to ba oyo bazali na COVID-19 esengeli balandela bango.

sourceString: The use of birthing pools is not recommended for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 due to the risk of infection via faeces.
targetString: Kobota na kati ya mayi ezali malamu te mpona ba oyo bakoki kozala to bazali na COVID-19 mpo risk ya maladi ezali molayi na tufi.

sourceString: In the UK, official recommendations state that precautionary separation of a mother and a healthy baby should not be undertaken lightly and that they should be kept together in the postpartum period where neonatal care is not required.Literature from China recommended separation of infected mothers from babies for 14 days.
targetString: Na UK, gouvernema epesi toli ete kokabola mama na mwana esalema pamba te batika bango esika moto ata nsima ya kobota esika kokipe mwana esengeli. Bamanuskri na Chine esengi bakabola bamama ya maladi na bana mpona mikolo 14.

sourceString: In the US there is also the recommendation that newborns and mothers should be temporarily separated until transmission-based precautions are discontinued, and that where this is not possible the newborn should be kept 2 metres away from the mother.
targetString: Na US mpe balobi esengeli bakabola mwana na mama ti mosala ya kopekisa maladi etambola esalemi, mpe soki oyo ekoki kosalema te, mwana afanda mosika na mama na ye na 2 metele.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.
targetString: Kokengela b'COVID-19 ezali kososola kopalangana ya maladi ya coronavirisi mpona komona ndenge nini maladi ezali kopusa.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, with focus of case finding, testing and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.
targetString: Organisation Mondiale ya Sante esengi kokengela ya pene, kati ya koluka bato ya malad, kosala ekzame mpe kolandela na bisika nyonso.

sourceString: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
targetString: Kokengela ya COVID-19 ezali mpona kolandela pandemi, koyeba noki bato oyo bazali na maladi, mpe na oyo eyebani kosalisa eyano ya pandemi koyeba barisk mpe kobongisama.

sourceString: Syndromic surveillance is done based on the symptoms of an individual that corresponds to COVID-19.
targetString: Kokengela ya syndromic ezali kosalema nsima ya basymptmi oyo ezali lekola ya COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the WHO recommends the following case definitions:
targetString: Na sanza ya misato 2020, OMS epesi definition ya ba oyo:

sourceString: Probable case : "A suspect case for whom testing for the COVID-19 virus is inconclusive" OR "a suspect case for whom testing could not be performed for any reason".
targetString: Oyo ekoki kozala : ‘'Moto oyo akoki kozala na maladi mpe ekzame ya virisi ya COVID-19 elakisi malamu te'' TO ‘'moto oyo akoki kozala na maladi kasi akokaki kosala ekzame te''.

sourceString: Confirmed case: "A person with laboratory confirmation of COVID-19 infection, irrespective of clinical signs and symptoms".
targetString: Moto oyo azali kobela: ‘'Moto oyo ekzame ya laboratoire emoni COVID-19, etali basymptomi te to makambo misusu''.

sourceString: Direct physical contact with a probable or confirmed case;
targetString: pene na nzoto na moto oyo akoki to azali na maladi;

sourceString: Direct care for a patient with probable or confirmed COVID-19 disease without using proper personal protective equipment;
targetString: Kosalisa moto oyo azali kobela na COVID-19 na kozanga kobatela nzoto;

sourceString: Other situations as indicated by local risk assessments".WHO recommends reporting of probable and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.
targetString: Misusu elobami na bakonzi ya risk''. OMS epesi toli bayebisa ba oyo bakoki kozala na COVID-19 bangonga 48 te eleka.

sourceString: The countries should report on a case-by-case basis as far as possible, but in case of limitation in resources, aggregate weekly reporting is also possible.
targetString: Esengeli bamboka bareporte mpona moto na moto soki bakoki, kasi soki bakoki te, kasi bapesa barapor poso nyonso.

sourceString: Some organizations have created crowdsourced apps for syndromic surveillance, where people can report their symptoms to help researchers map areas with concentration of COVID-19 symptoms.
targetString: Ba organisations misusu bazali baapplication ya kolandela, bato bakoki kokoma basymptomi mpona kosunga bayekoli bayeba bisika oyo COVID-19 ezali makasi.

sourceString: Virological surveillance is done by using molecular tests for COVID-19.
targetString: Kokengela virology ezali kosalema na kosala ekzame ya COVID-19.

sourceString: WHO has published resources for laboratories on how to perform testing for COVID-19.
targetString: OMS ebimisi mikando ya ndenge esengeli balaboraroire basala ekzame ya COVID-19.

sourceString: In the European Union, laboratory confirmed cases of COVID-19 are reported within 24 hours of identification.
targetString: Na Union Europeene, laboratoire emonaki bato na COVID-19 na bangonga 24.

sourceString: At least 24 countries have established digital surveillance of their citizens.
targetString: Bambona 24 ezali kokengela bato na bango na nzela ya internet.

sourceString: The digital surveillance technologies include apps, location data and electronic tags.
targetString: Biloko ya kokengela ezali, baapplications, koyeba esika oyo bato bazali mpe kolanda bango na internet.

sourceString: The Center For Disease Control and Prevention in USA tracks the travel information of individuals using airline passenger data.
targetString: Esika ya kolandela mpe kopekisa bamaladi na US elandi banzela oyo bato baleki na kolanda tike na bango.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, authorities are requiring a bracelet and an app for all travellers.
targetString: Na Hong Kong, gouvernema esengi bato balata ekomo na loboko mpe applications mpona ba oyo basali nzela.

sourceString: A GPS app is used to track the locations of individuals in South Korea to ensure against quarantine breach, sending alerts to the user and to authorities if people leave designated areas.
targetString: Application moko ya GPS ezali kosalema mpona koyeba wapi bato bazali na Core ya Sud mpona babuka mibeko ya konfinema te, kotinda baalert na moto mpe na gouvernema soki moto abimi libanda ya ndako.

sourceString: In Singapore, individuals have to report their locations with photographic proof.
targetString: Na Singapore, bato esengeli bayebisa esika bazali na konfinema na kokanga foto.

sourceString: Thailand is using an app and SIM cards for all travelers to enforce their quarantine.
targetString: Thailand ezali kosalisa application mpe bakarte sim ya bato nyonso oyo basali nzela mpona konfinema.

sourceString: Human rights organizations have criticized some of these measures, asking the governments not to use the pandemic as a cover to introduce invasive digital surveillance.
targetString: Baorganisation ya bonsomi basepeli te na ndenge makambo ezali kosalema, basengi bavougernema bazwa pandemi te mpona kokengela bato.

sourceString: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.
targetString: ba b'coronavirusi bazali liboke ya ba virusi ekangana óyo epesaka bokono na bamammifère pe bandeke.

sourceString: In humans, coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal.
targetString: Na bato, ba coronavirusi ebendaka infection ya nzela ya kopema mutu eko kozala pasi moke tii na pasi ya liwâ.

sourceString: Mild illnesses include some cases of the common cold (which has other possible causes, predominantly rhinoviruses), while more lethal varieties can cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.
targetString: Mabela ma pete etie nakati grippe ya bato mingi (mutu ewutaka na bakpokoso mosusu, mingi-mingi penza ya barhinovirusi), bongo óyo ebomaka eko kobenda SRAS, MERS, pe COVID-19.

sourceString: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.
targetString: Ba symptome na esipece mosusu ekesanaka: na basoso, epesaka bokono ya nzela ya kopemela, kasi na bangombe na bangulu nde epesaka pulu-pulu.

sourceString: There are yet to be vaccines or antiviral drugs to prevent or treat human coronavirus infections.
targetString: Ba vaccin na kisi ya antivirusi naino ekelami te mpóna kosilisa to kopekisa bakpokoso ya coronavirusi na bato.

sourceString: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi ezali nase ya libota ya infection ya Orthocoronavirinae, na kati ya libota ya Coronaviridae, molongo ya Nidovirales, pe domaine ya Riboviria.

sourceString: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.
targetString: Bazali ba virusi ya kati ya poso ezalaka na genome RNA moko ya sens unique ekangama nakati pe na noyau ya symmetrie helicale .

sourceString: The genome size of coronaviruses ranges from approximately 26 to 32 kilobases, one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Bonene ya genome ya ba coronavirusi ezalaka penepene ya bakilobase 26 tii 32, moko ya kabakata ya kati ya ba virusi ya RNA.

sourceString: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.
targetString: Bazalaka na banzete lokola barayon óyo ebimaka banda surface na bango bongo na ba graphiiki micro electron emonanaka na elili lokola couronne ya sanza ya moi esika kómbó ewutaki.

sourceString: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).
targetString: Ba coronavirusi ekundolamaki liboso na mibu 1930s tángo infection ya kopema ya makasi ya basoso ya mboka esi emonani ete ewutaki na pasi ya virusi ya bronchite (IBV).

sourceString: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
targetString: Na mibu 1940s, ba coronavirusi mibale lisúsu ya bibwele ekundolamaki, hepatite ya puku (MHV) virusi ya gastroenterite contagieux (TGEV), ezalaki isolé. Ba coronavirusi ya bato ekundolamaki na mibu 1960s.

sourceString: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
targetString: Ya liboso penza eyekolamaki ezalaki na babeli ya bato bazalaki na malili ya bato banso, mutu ebengamaki sima coronavirusi 229E ya bato pe coronavirusi OC43 ya bato.

sourceString: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.
targetString: Bamonanaki liboso na elili na virologue ya Esoselo June Almeida na St. Thomas Hospital na Londre.

sourceString: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi mosusu ya bato esi eyebani banda tángo wana, tia nakati SARS-CoV na 2003, HCoV NL63 na 2004, HKU1 na 2005, MERS-CoV na 2012, pe SARS-CoV-2 na 2019.

sourceString: Most of these have involved serious respiratory tract infections.
targetString: Toloba nionso wana ekotisi nakati ba infection ya somo na nzela ya kopema.

sourceString: The name was first used in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to designate the new family of viruses.
targetString: Basalelaka kómbó yango mbala liboso na 1968 na lisanga ya baninga ba virologue na mokandá ya zulunali Nature mpóna kobenga libota ya sika ya ba virusi.

sourceString: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
targetString: Nkombo etalisi mosapi na ndenge ba virion (biloko ya virusi óyo epesaka infection) emonanaka na microsicope ya electroniki, yango ezalaka na bandelo ya basende ebimaka na surface ya monene esalaki elili óyo emonanaka lokola couronne to couronne ya sanza moi.

sourceString: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
targetString: Morphologi yango ekelami na barayon peplomere ya virusi, mutu ezali ba proteine na surface ya virusi.

sourceString: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi ezali biteni pleomorphiki ya kamwa monene mike-mike a ronde na surface ya songe.

sourceString: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
targetString: Mposo ya virusi kati ya ba micrographi ya electron emonanaka lokola paire distincte ya bacoquille epaisse ya electron. Mposo ya virusi ezalaka na bacouche mibale ya lipide esika membrane (M), poso (E) pe rayon (S) botongami ya baproteine ya botongami ekangamaka.

sourceString: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
targetString: Mposo ya ba couche mibale ya lipide, baproteine ya membrane, pe capsule ya noyau ebatelaka virusi tángo ezalaka libanda ya cellule moyambi.

sourceString: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi ezalaka na kati na yango na sens-positif, genome ARN monocatenaire.

sourceString: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
targetString: Dimensio ya genome ya coronavirusi ekendeke banda bakilobase 26.4 ti 31.7.

sourceString: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Dimensio ya genome nango ezali moko ya ba virusi ARN elekaka monene penza.

sourceString: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
targetString: Ba cadre efungwama ya kotangela 1a na 1b, moto ezalaka na ndambo mibale likolo ya misato ya liboso ya genome, ezo codé polyproteine replicase/transcriptase.

sourceString: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
targetString: Polyproteine replicase/transcriptase ekomisokolaka mpo esála baproteine nonstructurale. Ba cadre ya kotangela ya suka ecodaka baproteine structurale minei : rayon, poso, membrane, pe nucleocapside.

sourceString: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
targetString: Etelangani nakati ya ba cadre ya kotanga yango ezali ba cadre ya kotanga mpóna baproteine accessoire.

sourceString: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
targetString: Talo ya baproteine accessoire na mosala nabango ezalaka unique na coronavirusi specifiki,.

sourceString: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
targetString: infection ebandaka soki rayon (S) ya virusi glycoproteine ekangamaka na cellule moyambi ya kobakisa.

sourceString: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
targetString: Simá ya bokangani, protéase moko ya cellule moyambi ekangami pe e activé rayon ya bokangami ya proteine moyambi.

sourceString: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
targetString: Na botali ya protéase ya cellule moyambi elongobani, bokangani na activasio esalaka ete virusi ekota na cellule moyambi na nzela ya endocytose to bokangani ya libela ya poso ya virusi na membrane ya moyambi. Na bokoti na cellule moyambi, eténi ya virusi elatisami, ebongo genome nango ekoti na cytoplasme ya cellule.

sourceString: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
targetString: Ribosoma moyambi ebongolaka bosangani ya liboso ya cadre efungwama ya cadre ya genome ya virusi pe esalaka polyprotéine ya molai.

sourceString: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
targetString: Politiki eza na baprotéase na yemoko moto ekangaka polyprotéine na baprotéine nonstructurale mingi.

sourceString: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
targetString: Lotango ya baproteine nonstructurale ekanganaka mpóna kosala multi-protéine replicase-transcriptase complexe (RTC).

sourceString: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
targetString: Protéine replicase-transcriptase eza ARN-dependant ARN polymérase (RdRp).

sourceString: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
targetString: Ekotaki libela na lisalisi ya korepliqué pe kotranscrire ARN ewuti na echeki ya ARN.

sourceString: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
targetString: Baprotéine nonstructurale mosusu nakati ya complexe esalisaka na nzela ya korepliqué pe ko transcrire.

sourceString: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
targetString: Protéine exoribonucléase nonstructurale, na ndakisa, epesaka botosi ya kobakisa mpóna korepliqué na kopesa mosala ya kotangolola óyo ARN-dependant ARN polymerase ezangaka. Moko ya misala makasi ya complexe ezo repliqué genome virale.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: RdRp elinganasaka libela-libela synthese ya ARN ya genomiki ya sense-negatif uta na ARN ya genomiki ya sense positif.

sourceString: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: Yangó elandamaka na replicasio ya ARN ya genomiki ya sense-positif uta na ARN ya genomiki ya sense negatif.

sourceString: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
targetString: Fonkisio mosusu ya ntina makasi mpóna complexe ezali kotranscrire genome ya virusi.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: RdRp elinganasaka libela-libela synthese ya bamolecule subgenomiki ARN ya sense-negatif uta na genomiki ARN ya sense positif.

sourceString: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
targetString: Yangó elandamaka na transcription ya ba molecule subgenomiki ARN ya sense-negatif óyo ezo kokana na ba mRNA ya sense-positif.

sourceString: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
targetString: Genomiki repliqué ya sense-positifi ARN ekomi genome ya ba virusi ebotami.

sourceString: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
targetString: Ba mRNA eza bagene batranscrire na moko ya misato ya suka ya ba genome ya virusi sima ya bomatani ya yambo na botangi ya cadre.

sourceString: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
targetString: Ba mRNA yango ebongolami na moyambi ya ba ribosome kati ya ba proteine structurale na ndambo ya proteine accessoire.

sourceString: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
targetString: Bobongoli ya ARN esalamaka na kati ya reticulum endoplasmiki.

sourceString: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
targetString: Baprotéine ya structure ya virusi S, E, pe M ekendeke na nzela ya emoniseli kuna na kati ya disuku ya kati ya Golgi .

sourceString: There, the M proteins direct most protein-protein interactions required for assembly of viruses following its binding to the nucleocapsid.
targetString: Na kati kuna, ba proteine M etindaka bosangani mingi-mingi ya baproteine bango na bango mpóna kokangisa bavirusi sima ya bobatami naye na nucleocapside.

sourceString: Progeny viruses are then released from the host cell by exocytosis through secretory vesicles.
targetString: Ba virusi ya mbotama sima ekendeke na cellule ya boyambi na exocytosis na nzela ya secretion ya bavesicule.

sourceString: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.
targetString: Bosangani ya barayon ya proteine ya coronavirusi na moyambi ya kobakisa naye eza kati penza mpóna koyeba batissu tropisme, bokotisi kpokoso, na espece ya virusi.

sourceString: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.
targetString: Coronavirusi ya SRAS, na ndakisa, etandaka kpokoso na bacellule ya bato na bokangami na ba recepteur ya ba enzyme 2 ya angiotensine-ya bobaloli (ACE2).

sourceString: The scientific name for coronavirus is Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.
targetString: Kombo ya bakundoli ya mayele mpóna Coronavirusi ezali Orthocoronavirinae to Coronavirinae.

sourceString: Coronaviruses belong to the family of Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Ba Coronavirusi bazali na libota ya Coronaviridae, molongo ya ba Nidovirale, pe domaine ya Riboviria.

sourceString: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus
targetString: Genre Betacoronavirusi; type ya ba espece: Coronavirusi ya Murine

sourceString: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)
targetString: Ba espece: Betacoronavirusi 1 (coronavirusi ya Ngúlu, coronavirusi ya Bato OC43), coronavirusi ya Bato HKU1, coronavirusi ya Murine, coronavirusi ya ngembo Pipistrellus HKU5, coronavirusi ya ngembo Rousettus HKU9, coronavirusi ekangani na ba syndrome-ya pasi ya pema (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), coronavirusi ya ngembo Tylonycteris HKU4, coronavirusi ya syndrome ya pema ya Moyen Orient, coronavirusi 1 Hedgehog (EriCoV)

sourceString: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus
targetString: Ba espece: coronavirusi ya balaine Beluga SW1, infection ya virusi ya bronchite

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as recently as 8000 BCE, although some models place the common ancestor as far back as 55 million years or more, implying long term coevolution with bat and avian species.
targetString: Nkóko ya mikolo mokuse mileki (MRCA) ekangisi bango bacoronavirusi nionso ekaniselami kozala kala mingi te na ba mbula 8000 BCE, kasi nde ba modele mosusu etiaka nkoko ya bango nionso kala mingi penza na mibu ba million 55 to molai, elingi koloba bokoli ya espece ya ngembo na avian.

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
targetString: Nkóko ya mikolo eleki ekangisi bango na molongo ya alphacoronavirusi etiamami molai ya kala toloba na 2400 BCE, molongo ya betacoronavirusi na 3300 BCE, molongo ya gammacoronavirusi na 2800 BCE, pe molongo ya deltacoronavirusi na toloba 3000 BCE.

sourceString: The large number of host bat and avian species, and their global range, has enabled extensive evolution and dissemination of coronaviruses.Many human coronavirus have their origin in bats.
targetString: Lotángo monene ya ba especeya ngembo-bayambi na ba avian, pe na molongo na bango ya mokili mobimba, epesi nzela na bokoli monene na bopalangani ya ba coronavirusi. Ba coronavirusi mingi ya bato ewutaki na bangembo.

sourceString: More recently, alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged sometime before 1960.
targetString: Na ntango mokuse eleki, coronavirusi ya alpaka pe coronavirusi ya bato 229E ekabwanaki na ba1960.

sourceString: MERS-CoV emerged in humans from bats through the intermediate host of camels.
targetString: MERS-CoV eye kobimela na bato ewuti na ngembo na boleki nzela ya bapunda.

sourceString: MERS-CoV, although related to several bat coronavirus species, appears to have diverged from these several centuries ago.
targetString: MERS-CoV, ta ko ekangani na ba espece ya coronavirusi ebele, emonani ete ekabwanaka ba siècle mingi eleki.

sourceString: The most closely related bat coronavirus and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi ya ngembo na ya SRAS-CoV ekangami na mikolo mike mileki ekabwanaki na 1986.

sourceString: A possible path of evolution, of SARS coronavirus and keen bat coronaviruses, suggests that SARS related coronaviruses coevolved in bats for a long time.
targetString: Nzela ekaniselami na bokoli ya coronavirusi SRAS pe ba coronavirusi ya ngembo, elakisi ete ba coronavirusi ekangani na SRAS ebimaki elongo na ngembo kala mingi.

sourceString: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus diverged from the bovine coronavirus after a cross-species jump.
targetString: Na mibu 1790, coronavirusi ya nvalu ewutaki na bangulu sima ya bokatisi kati ya ba espece.

sourceString: Later in the 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 diverged from bovine coronavirus after another cross-species spillover event.
targetString: Na sima, na mibu 1890s, coronavirusi ya bato OC43 ekendaka nzela mosusu longwa na coronavirusi ya ngulu sima ya bofunmpuki ya bokatisi ya ba espece.

sourceString: It is speculated that the flu pandemic of 1890 may have been caused by this spillover event, and not by the influenza virus, because of the related timing, neurological symptoms, and unknown causative agent of the pandemic.
targetString: Ezo kanisama ete pandemi ya grippe ya 1890 esalamaki na ntina ya etumba ya bofunmpuki, kasi na virusi ya malili te, na ntina ya tango ekanganaki, basymptome ya virologie, na eloko ebendaka pandemi eyebani te.

sourceString: Human coronavirus OC43 besides causing respiratory infections is also suspected of playing a role in neurological diseases.
targetString: Coronavirusi ya bato OC43 libanda ya kopesa infection ya kopema eza pe kokaniselama kotia pasi na kobéla ya misisa.

sourceString: In the 1950s, the human coronavirus OC43 began to diverge into its present genotypes.
targetString: Na mibu 1950s, coronavirusi ya bato OC43 ebandaki kokende nzela ekoma genotype ya lelo.

sourceString: Phylogentically, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), which infects the mouse's liver and the central nervous system, is related to  human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.
targetString: Na bolandi nzela ya Phylogenetiki, virusi ya hepatite ya mpuku (coronavirusi Murine), mutu etiaka infection na libale pe systeme ya misisa ya centre, eza na bokangani na coronavirusi ya bato OC43 pe coronavirusi ya ngulu.

sourceString: Human coronavirus HKU1, like the aforementioned viruses, also has its origins in rodents.
targetString: coronavirusi ya bato HKU1, lokola ba virusi elobilami likolo, lisusu ezali na bowuti nango na bampuku.

sourceString: Coronaviruses vary significantly in risk factor.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi ekesanaka mingi na likama ebendaka.

sourceString: Some can kill more than 30% of those infected, such as MERS-CoV, and some are relatively harmless, such as the common cold.
targetString: Ndámbo nango eko koboma koleka 30% ya bato babelaka yango, ndakisa MERS-CoV, pe ndambo ya baye bazangaka kpokoso ndakisa malili bato mingi babelaka.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause colds with major symptoms, such as fever, and a sore throat from swollen adenoids.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi eko kopesa malili na basymptome makasi, lokola fievre, pe pasi na mongongo mpóna kovimba ya ba adenoide.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause pneumonia (either direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (either direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).
targetString: Ba coronavirusi eko kobenda panzi (ezala panzi ya virusi ya libela to panzi ya babacteria secondaire) pe bronchite (ezala bronchite ya virusi ya libela to bronchite ya babacteria secondaire).

sourceString: The human coronavirus discovered in 2003, SARS-CoV, which causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), has a unique pathogenesis because it causes both upper and lower respiratory tract infections.Six species of human coronaviruses are known, with one species subdivided into two different strains, making seven strains of human coronaviruses altogether.
targetString: coronavirusi ya bato ekundolamaki na 2003, SRAS-CoV, mutu ebendaka basyndrome ya makasi ya kopema (SRAS), eza na pathogene ya yemoko na ntina ete ebendaka mibale ya kpokoso ya likolo pe ya se ya nzela ya kopemela. Ba espece motoba ya ba coronavirusi ya bato eyebani, espece moko ekabwani na basouche ya ndenge mibale, esalaka basouche sambo na nionso ya ba coronavirusi ya bato.

sourceString: Four of these coronaviruses continually circulate in the human population and produce the generally mild symptoms of the common cold in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.
targetString: Mine ya bacoronavirusi etambolaka mbala na mbala kati ya bato pe ebotaka basymptome ya pasi penza te ya malili ya bato banso ya bakolo na ya bana mike mokili mobimba : -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.

sourceString: Coronaviruses cause about 15% of commons colds.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi ebendaka toloba 15% ya malili ya bato banso.

sourceString: The majority of colds are caused by rhinoviruses.
targetString: Mingi penza ya bamalili ebendamaka na barhinovirusi.

sourceString: The four mild coronaviruses have a seasonal incidence occurring in the winter months in temperate climates.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi minei ya pete ebetaka batu na ba saison bongo eyaka basanza ya malili ya balimboli temperé.

sourceString: There is no preference towards a particular season in tropical climates.
targetString: Boponi ezali te na likambo etali ba saison ya baclimat ya tropique .

sourceString: The virus was officially named the SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).
targetString: virusi óyo loyalo apesaka yango Kombo ya SRAS coronavirusi (SARS-CoV).

sourceString: More than 8,000 people were infected, about ten percent of whom died.
targetString: Koleka bato 8,000 bazwaki infection, toloba ba pourcent zomi ya bango bakufaki.

sourceString: In September 2012, a new type of coronavirus was identified, initially called Novel Coronavirus 2012, and now officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Na Septemba 2012, type ya coronavirusi ya sika emonanaki, liboso epesamaki nkombo ya coronavirusi Yasika 2012, pe sik'óyo loyalo abengi yango coronavirusi ya syndrome ya pema ya Moyen Orient (MERS-CoV).

sourceString: The World Health Organization issued a global alert soon after.
targetString: OMS abimisaki liyebisi ya mokili mobimba noki-noki sima na yango.

sourceString: The WHO update on 28 September 2012 said the virus did not seem to pass easily from person to person.
targetString: Mis a jour ya OMS ya 28 Septemba 2012 elobaki ete virusi ezangaki bokasi ya koleka pasi te na moto na moto.

sourceString: However, on 12 May 2013, a case of human-to-human transmission in France was confirmed by the French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.
targetString: Kási, na 12 Mai 2013, cas moko ya moto-apesi-moto endimamaki na France na ministere ya misala ya Bato na Santé ya Bato ya France.

sourceString: In addition, cases of human-to-human transmission were reported by the Ministry of Health in Tunisia.
targetString: Na kobakisa, ba cas moko ya moto-apesi-moto esalamaki lapolo na Ministere ya Santé ya Tunisia.

sourceString: Two confirmed cases involved people who seemed to have caught the disease from their late father, who became ill after a visit to Qatar and Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Mibale ya ba cas etali bato bakaniselaki bazwaki infection na tatá nabango mutu akufelaki yango tángo ya bokomi kobéla sima ya visite na Qatar pe Arabia Saudita.

sourceString: Despite this, it appears the virus had trouble spreading from human to human, as most individuals who are infected do not transmit the virus.
targetString: Longola óyo, ezo monana lokola virusi ebandaki na pasi penza na bopalangani na moto-apesi-moto, lokola bato mingi bazalaka na infection bapesaka yango na moto te.

sourceString: The final name for the virus is Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Kombo ya suka mpóna virusi eza coronavirusi ya syndrome ya kopema ya Moyen Orient (MERS-CoV).

sourceString: The only U.S. cases (both survived) were recorded in May 2014.In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in the Republic of Korea, when a man who had traveled to the Middle East, visited four hospitals in the Seoul area to treat his illness.
targetString: Ba cas kaka ya E.U., (mibale kasi babikaki) bakomamaki na Mai 2014. Na Mai 2015, kobéla ya MERS-CoV ebimaki na Republika ya Korea, tángo moto moko akendaki mobémbo na Moyen Orient, avisitaki balopitalo minei na Seoul mpo asalisa kobéla naye.

sourceString: This caused one of the largest outbreaks of MERS-CoV outside the Middle East.
targetString: Óyo nde ebimisaki moko ya mikakatano ya monene mingi penza ya MERS-CoV libanda ya Moyen Orient .

sourceString: As of December 2019, 2,468 cases of MERS-CoV infection had been confirmed by laboratory tests, 851 of which were fatal, a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.
targetString: Na Decemba 2019, 2,468 ya ba cas ya infection ya MERS-CoV eyaki kondimama na batesite ya laboratoire, 851 na yango ebomaki, to ya koboma ya ngambo 34.5%.

sourceString: In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak was reported in Wuhan, China.
targetString: Na Decemba 2019, infection a panzi ebimaki na Wuhan, Chine.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel strain of coronavirus, which was given the interim name 2019-nCoV by the World Health Organization (WHO), later renamed SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.
targetString: Na 31 Decemba 2019, mokakatano ekanganaki na lolenge ya sika ya coronavirusi, yango nde epesamaki nkombo ya 2019-nCoV na Organization Mondiale ya Santé (OMS), sima ebengamaki SRAS-CoV-2 na Comité International ya Taxonomie ya Ba virusi.

sourceString: Some researchers have suggested the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the original source of viral transmission to humans.As of 17 April 2020, there have been at least 153,822 confirmed deaths and more than 2,240,191 confirmed cases in the coronavirus pneumonia pandemic.
targetString: Bakundoli baike bakanisi baloba ete Zándo ya Kompaní ya Botekeli Bambisi ya Mái na gros ya Huanan ekoki nango te kozala esika ya yambo ya bopesi ya virusi na bato. Na 17 Avril 2020, eyaki koyebana ete bato bakufaki bandimamaki lotango 153,822 ebongo koleka 2,240,191 endimamaki na ba cas ya pandemie ya panzi ya coronavirusi .

sourceString: The Wuhan strain has been identified as a new strain of Betacoronavirus from group 2B with approximately 70% genetic similarity to the SARS-CoV.
targetString: Souche ya Wuhan esi emonani ete eza lolenge ya sika ya Betacoronavirusi ewúta na liboke 2B na ngambo ya 70% ya bokokani ya genetiki na SRAS-CoV.

sourceString: The virus has a 96% similarity to a bat coronavirus, so it is widely suspected to originate from bats as well.
targetString: virusi óyo ekokani 96% na coronavirusi ya ngembo, yango wana ekaniselami mingi kowúta lisusu na bangembo.

sourceString: The pandemic has resulted in travel restrictions and nationwide lockdowns in several countries.
targetString: Pandemie esúkeli na bopekisi bato batíka mibembo pe bikolo bikangama na bandáko na bikolo ebele.

sourceString: Coronaviruses have been recognized as causing pathological conditions in veterinary medicine since the 1930s.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi basi bayébana ndenge babéndaka pasi ya pathologie na mambi ma medecine baveterinaire banda ba 1930.

sourceString: Except for avian infectious bronchitis, the major related diseases have mainly an intestinal location.
targetString: Longola ba infection ya bronchite ya avian, mabela monene makangani mingi-mingi mazalaka kati ya mitsiopo.

sourceString: Coronaviruses primarily infect the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tract of mammals and birds.
targetString: Ba coronavirusi na liboso penza batiaka infection na likolo ya nzelá ya pema pe nzelá ya kifundu pe mitsiopo ya ba mamele na bandeke.

sourceString: They also cause a range of diseases in farm animals and domesticated pets, some of which can be serious and are a threat to the farming industry.
targetString: Bapesaka pe molongo ya mabela na bibwele ya ferme na bibwele ya ndako, ndambo na yango eko kozala ya pasi makasi pe ezalaka moniokoli na industrie ya bafermier.

sourceString: In chickens, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), a coronavirus, targets not only the respiratory tract but also the urogenital tract.
targetString: Na basoso, virusi ya bopesi infection ya bronchite(IBV), coronavirusi, ekendeke libela na nzelá kaka ya kopema te kasi pe na nzelá ya masúba.

sourceString: The virus can spread to different organs throughout the chicken.
targetString: virusi ekokí kopalangana na bangambo mosusu na ba organe ya soso.

sourceString: Economically significant coronaviruses of farm animals include porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) and bovine coronavirus, which both result in diarrhea in young animals.
targetString: Mpo na mombóngo ya bafermier moniokoli ya ntina ya bacoronavirusi etie nakati coronavirusi ya ngúlu (coronavirusi gastroenteritite ekabolamaka, TGE) coronavirusi ya ngombe, mibale nango epesaka pulupulu na bibwele ya mike.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus: two forms, feline enteric coronavirus is a pathogen of minor clinical significance, but spontaneous mutation of this virus can result in feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), a disease associated with high mortality.
targetString: Coronavirusi ya niawu: ndenge mibale, coronavirusi enteriki ya niawu ezalaka pathogene ya pasi te na cliniki, kasi nde mutation spontanée ya virusi yango eko kobenda infection ya peritonitite (FIP), kobéla mutu ebomaka mingi.

sourceString: Similarly, there are two types of coronavirus that infect ferrets: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes a gastrointestinal syndrome known as epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), and a more lethal systemic version of the virus (like FIP in cats) known as ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).
targetString: Lolenge moko, ba ndenge mibale ya coronavirsi ebendaka infection na ba ferreti: Coronavirusi enteriki ya ferreti ebendaka syndrome gastrointestinali eyebani na nkombo ya epizootiki catarrhale enteritis (ECE), pe version systemiki moko ya virusi yango ebomaka mingi (ndakisa FIP na baniawu) babengi coronavirusi systemiki ya ferreti (FSC).

sourceString: There are two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV), one that causes mild gastrointestinal disease and one that has been found to cause respiratory disease.
targetString: Bandenge eza mibale ya coronavirusi ya bacanine (CCoV), moko nango ebendaka kobéla ya gastrointestinale ya pete pe moko emonani epesaka kobéla ya pema.

sourceString: Mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) is a coronavirus that causes an epidemic murine illness with high mortality, especially among colonies of laboratory mice.
targetString: virusi ya hepatite ya mpuku (MHV) eza coronavirusi ebimisaka maladie ya epidemie ya mpuku ya taux ya koboma ya likolo na mangomba ya ba mpuku ya laboratoire.

sourceString: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) is highly infectious coronavirus of laboratory rats, which can be transmitted between individuals by direct contact and indirectly by aerosol.
targetString: virusi ya Sialodacryoadenitis (SDAV) eza coronavirusi ya bampuku ya laboratoire epesaka infection ya makasi penza, mutu eko kolekisama na moto-na-moto na kosimba libela pe libela te na aerosole.

sourceString: Some strains of MHV cause a progressive demyelinating encephalitis in mice which has been used as a murine model for multiple sclerosis.
targetString: Ba lolenge kamwa ya MHV ebendaka encephalitite demyelinating ya malembe na bampuku óyo basalelaki mpóna modele ya mpuku mpóna sclerose multiple.

sourceString: Significant research efforts have been focused on elucidating the viral pathogenesis of these animal coronaviruses, especially by virologists interested in veterinary and zoonotic diseases.
targetString: Maluki makasi ya ntina matie miso mingi na bobakisi moi na bapathogene ya virusi coronavirusi ya nyama yango, mingi penza na bavirologiste balingi koyeba mambi ma mabela ya baveterinaire na bazoonotiki.

sourceString: Porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus of pigs, TGEV).
targetString: coronavirusi ya ngúlu (coronavirusi gastroenteritite ya bangúlu ekabolamaka, TGEV).

sourceString: Bovine coronavirus (BCV), responsible for severe profuse enteritis in of young calves.
targetString: coronavirusi ya ngombe (BCV), ememaka mokumba ya botie infection ya pasi mingi ya enterite ya bana ngúlu.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) causes mild enteritis in cats as well as severe Feline infectious peritonitis (other variants of the same virus).
targetString: Coronavirusi ya banianwu (FCoV) ebendaka infection ya pete ya enterite na baniawu elongo na infection makasi ya peritonite (bavariant mosusu ya virusi ya ndenge moko).

sourceString: the two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV) (one causing enteritis, the other found in respiratory diseases).
targetString: ba coronavirusii mibale ya canine (CCoV) (moko epesaka enterite, mosusu emonani na pasi ya pema).

sourceString: Turkey coronavirus (TCV) causes enteritis in turkeys.
targetString: coronavirusii ya autriche (TCV) ebendaka enteritite na ba autriche.

sourceString: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes epizootic catarrhal enteritis in ferrets.
targetString: coronavirusii enteriki ya ferreti ebendaka enteritite epizootiki catarrhale na baferreti.

sourceString: Ferret systemic coronavirus causes FIP-like systemic syndrome in ferrets.
targetString: coronavirusii systemiki ya ferreti ebendaka syndrome systemiki ekokani na FIP na baferreti.

sourceString: Rabbit enteric coronavirus causes acute gastrointestinal disease and diarrhea in young European rabbits.
targetString: coronavirusii enteriki ya nlumba ebendaka kobéla pasi ya gastrointestinale na pulu-pulu na bana nlumba ya Europa.

sourceString: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED or PEDV), has emerged around the world.
targetString: virusii ya epidemiki ya pulu-pulu ya ngulu(PED to PEDV), esi ebimi na mokili.
